programme.title: The Sudheide - Woods, meadows, open country
programme.desc: Forests and fields, moors and heathland, shepherds and sheep - these are the symbols of an ostensibly unspoilt landscape that has inspired poets and painters alike for centuries. The secret of the almost 500 km² nature reserve Naturpark Sudheide lies in its diversity: the origins of its soil, geology and topography can be traced back to the ice age. But the region between Hamburg and Hannover is anything but unspoilt. For centuries, it was synonymous with heathland farmers and formed as a North German cultivated landscape. This documentary tells of an almost unknown region, which has been strongly influenced by mankind for centuries, yet still remains diverse in its nature. Nature...

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Deer
programme.desc: 30 million white-tailed deer live in the United States. They have begun to adapt themselves to living in a world of traffic, pets and backyards. In Cayuga Heights, New York, the suburb’s residents are trying to get used to this exceptional living arrangement. The deer can be spotted daily from kitchen windows and porches. Life in the suburbs is deer heaven – large areas of grass, no predators and plenty of water means their population is on a steady rise. In this documentary, white-tailed deer are outfitted with special cameras to take the viewer into their world. Deercam allows us to see them in a new light – not frozen in the headlights of a car or as shy residents of the woods, but...

programme.title: Strandwolf
programme.desc: She moves through the seal colony on Namibia’s wild Skeleton Coast with purpose and focus, gingerly stepping around the adults who snap at her heels. She’s searching for smaller prey. Following her is a young German field scientist, Ingrid Wiesel, who has now spent 17 years with Tosca’s clan; tracking, observing, and learning everything she can about one of the world’s least understood and most unusual predators.

programme.title: King of the Mountains - Golden Eagle
programme.desc: Aerial shots of mating Golden eagles, a clash between a Golden and a White-tailed eagle, and an intimate glimpse into their nesting grounds combine to create a spectacular film. Tracking these majestic birds reveals the wild nature of their hunting grounds, showcasing the diverse animal and plant life that share their habitat with the king of the skies. Viewers are brought up close as the eagle effortlessly glides over forests and canyons, abruptly diving in a breathtaking pursuit of prey. Witnessing these birds in their natural habitats is witnessing them at their finest. Embark on a magnificent journey through the skies and landscapes with us.

programme.title: King of the Seas - Sea Eagle
programme.desc: The times where eagles have been seen as varmints are over. They are now perceived as an integral part of the food cycle. Due to the fact that the habitats of the sea eagles in Germany are largely found in the north-eastern regions that are rich in water, the movie accompanies the eagles to an island, home to hundreds of sea ravens, where they rob the baby sea ravens of their food. They seem to always profit from the successes of the fellow creatures in their habitats. This film introduces you to the expert poachers of the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Leap Of The Lynx
programme.desc: On the Iberian Peninsula, primeval landscapes are practically non-existent, so the Iberian lynx has lived on cultivated land for centuries – cattle, horse and pig pastures, cork oak forests, timberland, and even holy sites of pilgrimage. The diversity and beauty of these locations are truly stunning and their character and history as relevant to this story as that of the big cat itself. Until five years ago, both populations of Iberian lynx were quickly fading away. Their fragmented habitats were shrinking even further, they were starved by lack of prey and reduced by epidemics. But now, local authorities, scientists, landowners, and other groups have finally begun to act in unison.

programme.title: Bear Essentials
programme.desc: We follow three young bears of different species – polar bears, brown bears and sloth bears (like Baloo, the Jungle Book Bear) – that inhabit dramatically varied landscapes as they find their way in the world. We look at how their mothers teach them the skills they need to survive and watch the many dangers they face. Their young lives are full of learning, moments of great tenderness and life-threatening drama. Over three years all of our bears, despite hardships and losses along the way, prove they have what it takes, they all have learned their bear essentials.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly I
programme.desc: Wildlife film-makers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In Alaska a cunning grizzly threatens the son of Andreas Kieling, on the remote Wrangel Island in northern-east Siberia his colleague Uwe Anders is taken by surprise by a a polar bear, and off the coast of South Africa a diving-team is unexpectedly surrounded by white sharks. But the life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, life-threatening diseases and failing technical equipment: Deep in the vast rainforests of West Africa cameraman Klaus Scheurich nearly dies of malaria, and in South India a film team narrowly escapes death in a hot-air balloon accident....

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly II
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. A cunning grizzly grabs a salmon off Andreas Kielings fishing rod, in the depths of the Amazon River a diving team has a spooky encounter with piranhas, in the Mediterranean Sea the currents nearly push Thomas Behrend into the mouths of angry sperm whales defending a newborn - and cameramen who want to film jaguars in the dense jungle of South America become easy prey for the well camouflaged cats. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces and failing technical equipment: In the swamps of North Australia violent storms hold up the crossing of tearing...

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly III
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In the Kruger National Park Josef Jozefowicz steps into a lionesses den to film her cubs, in Alaska Andreas Kieling mingles with giant elk bulls in order to film them in action, and in Florida his colleague Zoltan Torok gets very close to an alligator mother guarding its nest. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, and failing technical equipment: the strong and tearing current of the Yukon River throws Andreas Kielings boat onto a gravel bank, in the Democratic Republik of Congo camerawoman Heike Grebe is separated from her colleagues in the dense...

programme.title: Moksgmol - The Quest for the Spirit Bear
programme.desc: A forest that lives off fish, a white bear that is not a polar bear, and wolves that feed off the ocean… Canada’s Great Bear Rain Forest is a strange and pristine world, a land that time almost forgot. The awe-inspiring northern coastline of British Columbia with its great fjords that rival those in Norway, is the habitat of numerous species and the scene for the amazing co-existence of wolves, ravens, salmon, bears and a mystical rainforest, whose lives are intricately intertwined…

programme.title: The Moose Detective
programme.desc: Moose are an iconic species and of great importance to Sweden. That is why the country counts on a very special expert - the moose detective. Recently, a problem has developed on Öland regarding its moose. For a few years now on the island, the moose calves have been dying shortly after birth. Its a mystery. Every effort is made to save them. The island has called upon the moose detective to investigate. He follows several leads. Soon one of the suspects is identified - climate change. But it is not easy to convict the culprit. There are other suspects as well, the food shortage for example. Maybe they have joined hands as accomplices. In Sweden moose are very important. They are game...

programme.title: Search for the Ghost Bears
programme.desc: Our film journey begins in Alaskas west. We are hoping to find glacier bears in the glacial regions of the Katmai National Park on the Douglas River. At the end of July, brown bears have now arrived to fish for salmon. In the surrounding forests, grizzlies look for berries and fresh, green twigs. The Katmai is Alaskas most volcanic area, and with 15 active volcanoes it is a veritable powder keg, surrounded by glaciers. In the Hook glacier region moose and lynx accompany us. Bald eagles have arrived at the glacial boundary and begin to tear apart their freshly caught prey. At last, we catch sight of a glacier bear. Hungry, he has left the ice region and has been forced down here in...

programme.title: A Winters Tale - The Journey of the Snowy Owls
programme.desc: Snowy owls live a life full of mystery up in the Arctic. Thousands of years ago, they built a community of fate with their neighbors – lemmings. About every four years, lemmings proliferate in huge numbers. This way, snowy owls have enough feed for their young. The owls lay up to eleven eggs and can successfully raise the chicks – each of them needs two to four lemmings per day. Lately, however, lemmings’ mass reproduction hasn’t been as regular in some parts of the Tundra. What will happen to them and the snowy owls? What is the ecological link here? And what will happen if one year the winter arrives way too early? The best way for many birds to adapt to the winter is to flee to the...

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Deer
programme.desc: 30 million white-tailed deer live in the United States. They have begun to adapt themselves to living in a world of traffic, pets and backyards. In Cayuga Heights, New York, the suburb’s residents are trying to get used to this exceptional living arrangement. The deer can be spotted daily from kitchen windows and porches. Life in the suburbs is deer heaven – large areas of grass, no predators and plenty of water means their population is on a steady rise. In this documentary, white-tailed deer are outfitted with special cameras to take the viewer into their world. Deercam allows us to see them in a new light – not frozen in the headlights of a car or as shy residents of the woods, but...

programme.title: Italys Uncharted Islands
programme.desc: Far from the glamour and spotlight of Lampedusa, Pantelleria is one of the best kept secrets among the Italian islands. Located closer to Tunisia than to the Italian mainland, Pantelleria closer to Tunisia than to the Italian mainland, Pantelleria has been nicknamed "The Last Island," a title also given by Giosuè Calaciura gave to his 2016 historical novel set on Pantelleria. Pantelleria, that is the island of lava, capers and of the liqueur wine that comes here Zibibbo. An island with an ancient history, where for centuries farmers and fishermen have pursued their craft. their craft. The famous Zibibbo grapes are cultivated here - among other things also on the vineyard that Gerard...

programme.title: Dream Islands Of Europe: Capri, Ischia and Procida
programme.desc: Capri and Ischia are world famous. From Naples, its just a short hop over to the two islands. Perfect destinations, then, for a weeks cruise along the Gulf of Naples and the adjoining Amalfi Coast to the south. There, Positano, Amalfi or Salerno as well as a handful of other mostly small harbor towns are extremely worthwhile destinations.

programme.title: mareTV: Venice - Lagoon and Legend
programme.desc: Venice has been attracting people as if by magic for centuries. The Italians call her La Serenissima, or the sublime. Perched on wooden posts, she braves the elements and the huge, annual surge of visitors. Vogalonga is the name of a Venetian sports competition for women, in which the participants row their boats standing. This is a tradition that Guilia and Elena also follow. They train hard, as the yearly regatta is soon to begin. Anyone caught driving their water vehicle with more than 7 km/h through the canals of Venice, risks getting a ticket from local policewoman Lorenza Mariutti. The reason: the resulting waves gnaw at the foundations of the grand palaces. Venetians are very...

programme.title: mareTV: Sardinia - Magical Island in the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Sardinia is the second-largest island in the Mediterranean. The Sardin-ians themselves say its a "continent for itself", a virtual world of its own, full of magic: A beach, gleaming in unreal pink shades, red corals protect against the evil eye and the inhabitants seem to remain forever young. On Sardinia, the owners of luxury yachts adopt sheep, fish have gold in their bellies and a giant mussel supplies the material for legendary sea silk. No one is surprised, that the Madonna goes on a sea cruise once a year.

programme.title: mareTV: Capri and the Amalfi Coast - Italys Ocean Legends
programme.desc: Capri was already in ancient times a place for the rich and beautiful. Today Capri is one of the most famous islands in the world. Millions of tourists visit it. But there are in fact still unknown corners on the island in the Gulf of Naples. Thus, at the very top of Capri, there is a hermit monastery with a view to the Vesuvius.

programme.title: Italy My Love
programme.desc: In ten coastal areas of Italy, we encounter people that have a very special relationship with their region. All of them love their country, their traditions and their work. We met with enthusiasts and hedonists that permitted us to take a glimpse into their everyday lives. Young Italians, who have rediscovered nature and its treasures. Others, that preserve the beauty, archaeologists that apply whole new methods, farmers that only cultivate that which the soil needs. Fishermen, who fish in the same way as it was done a century ago and tough, young men who play and dance the Tarantella. Dolphins, giant sea turtles and pink flamingos, which are researched, nursed back to health or simply...

programme.title: mareTV: Corsica - Fascinating Mountain World in the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Corsica looks like an alpine landscape in the Mediterranean, an island with dramatic rock formations, romantic bays and proud inhabitants who see themselves first and foremost as Corsicans and only then as French. The Greeks in ancient times called the island Kalliste: the beautiful. We explore this fascinating mountain world in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: mareTV: Santorini - The Beauty on the Powder Keg
programme.desc: The Santorini archipelago is a gem, but is located on a veritable powder keg. It is only a matter of time before the volcano, the crater rim of which gave us this island world, erupts again. Since January 2011, threatening rumblings have been perceived beneath the archipelago. On Santorini, its a case of getting nowhere fast without a mule. Whether the restaurant terraces above the abyss of Oia, the hotels on the breath-taking cliffs of Imerovigli or Firostefani, it was only with the help of the stubborn climbing artists, that these daring constructions were made possible. Antonis Vlachos has ten strong mules that work for him. He transports almost everything with them: stones, food or...

programme.title: mareTV: The Blue and White Island World of Greece: Mykonos, Naxos and Tinos
programme.desc: Around the once sacred Isle of Delos, some 200 islands, including 20 larger ones, are arranged almost in a circle. This is where the name of the Greek island paradise comes from: Cyclades, a derivation of the Greek word kýklos, circle. Each cyclade has a unique character. The pelican Petros, about 20 years old, is the mascot of Mykonos. He moves from taverna to taverna all day long, scrounging fish. This works out sometimes well and sometimes not so well. Petros does have a few human friends who regularly slip him something, but all too often visitors eager to take pictures block his path. Then he has to "wiggle" his way through the crowd. Jackie Onassis is said to have once brought...

programme.title: The Turkish Riviera - The flair of antiquity and a turquoise sea
programme.desc: With a coastline boasting miles of bathing beaches, turquoise waters, breath-taking cliffs whilst being steeped in history, the Turkish riviera was even a fa-vourite of the Ancient Greeks, Romans and Ottomans, who all loved the mild climate and the lush landscape. Near the ruins of the ancient city of Side, Menderes Akdemir works on the latest attraction aimed at Riviera holidaymakers: his spooky pirate ship "Big Kral" is due to leave dry dock and head for the sea. Mehmet Özata came up with a very clever idea: to be able to cope with the basically ruinous puffer fish plague along the coastline, he produces a selection of leather utensils made of their skin. The islands that surround the...

programme.title: Montenegro - From the Black Mountains to the Beach
programme.desc: The Balkan land of Montenegro owes its name to the Black Mountains. But there is so much more: steep cliffs, deep gorges, picturesque lakes, orthodox monasteries, Venetian architecture, sandy beaches and even fjords like those of Norway. There are three climate zones alone in the Adriatic. The inhabitants still try to find their way between the challenges of a post-socialist system, the much-vaunted Balkan remoteness and the opportunities of a still almost completely undiscovered tourist destination in Europe.

programme.title: North Macedonia: Between Traditional Dances and Mini Navy
programme.desc: Northern Macedonia emerged from being a once constituent republic of the former Yugoslavia. Anyone wishing to discover unknown worlds has every chance of finding them in this young Balkan country, full of imposing mountains, lakes of crystal-clear water, original villages and centuries-old customs. Nevertheless, Northern Macedonia, which borders Serbia in the north and Greece in the south, considered to be one of the poorest countries in Europe.

programme.title: Italys Uncharted Islands
programme.desc: The Sulcis Archipelago is located off the south-western coast of Sardinia and is part of the province of of southern Sardinia. The islands of San Pietro, SantAntioco and Isola Piana form the archipelago, together with several uninhabited islets and rocks form the archipelago. It belongs to the less known areas in Italy and is little developed for tourism. Nevertheless stars like Tom Cruise and Roberto Cavalli come here to enjoy the peace, seclusion and good food. The islanders are only moderately interested in these visitors, and their down-to-earth attitude has never lost.

programme.title: Italys Uncharted Islands
programme.desc: Lake Iseo is located on the southern foothills of the Alps. It extends over the provinces of Brescia and Bergamo in the northern mainland of Italy. In the middle of Lake Iseo lies the largest island of the southern European inland waters. Monte Isola, as the island is called after its central mountain lies close to its two neighboring islands, Isola di San Paolo and Isola di Loreto. As early as the 11th century, a monastic association of Benedictines settled here. For many Italians, Lake Iseo is the most beautiful spot in their homeland. It is all the more astonishing how little the influence of tourism is here. Driving is strictly forbidden on the three islands, and only on Monte Isola....

programme.title: Italys Uncharted Islands
programme.desc: The Tuscan Archipelago is a group of islands at the height of Florence. The archipelago stretches from the Ligurian Sea to the Tyrrhenian Sea, north-east of Corsica. The archipelago consists of seven main islands - Giglio, Elba, Gianutri, Capraia, Pianisoa, Gorgona and Montecristo - and other smaller islands and rocks. Not all of them are inhabited. We look at the three most extraordinary islands of the archipelago: Elba, Capraia and the island of Montecristo. The Tuscan Archipelago is one of the most important natural wonders of the world and is protected as Parco Nazionale dellArcipelago Toscano. With its 61.474 hectares of protected and 17,694 hectares of protected land area, it is...

programme.title: Italys Uncharted Islands
programme.desc: Far from the glamour and spotlight of Lampedusa, Pantelleria is one of the best kept secrets among the Italian islands. Located closer to Tunisia than to the Italian mainland, Pantelleria closer to Tunisia than to the Italian mainland, Pantelleria has been nicknamed "The Last Island," a title also given by Giosuè Calaciura gave to his 2016 historical novel set on Pantelleria. Pantelleria, that is the island of lava, capers and of the liqueur wine that comes here Zibibbo. programme.title: Elephants: Back to the Wild
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Elephants: Back to the Wild: The Orphanage of Elephants - Nairobi Nationalpark
programme.desc: We follow the rescue of a baby elephant. Once rescued, it will be transported by plane to the breeding station and raised with love and commitment. In order to satisfy the little pachyderm’s urge to move while in the breeding station, there is sometimes an adorable football match between the animals.

programme.title: Elephants: Back to the Wild
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Elephants: Back to the Wild: The Return of the Elephants - Tsavo-East-Nationalpark
programme.desc: We accompany the first steps of a two-year-old elephant who is just starting his release program. We also observe the story of two young elephants in their first night in the wilderness on their own. Captivating film footage allows us to truly learn how elephants behave in the wild.

programme.title: Pinkfong Wonderstar

programme.title: Friends Forever
programme.desc: Mitch and Alex protect an orangutan, while Cody and Jessie deal with its abusive owner.

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: Cody puts his career, and life, on the line when he starts using a performance-enhancing supplement.

programme.title: The Big Blue
programme.desc: Mitch reunites an Army parachutist with her father, while Cody helps a free-diver reach a new "low.”

programme.title: Come Fly with Me
programme.desc: Mitch ends up on the wrong side of the law after he tries to save Tanner from his abusive father.

programme.title: Boys will be Boys
programme.desc: Craig tells Mitch a shocking secret. Jessie tries to end JD and Codys rivalry during a triathlon.

programme.title: Baywatch Grand Prix
programme.desc: Mitch feels the need for speed when Tanners cousin, Damon, a race car driver, visits Baywatch.

programme.title: Baywatch Down Under, Part 1
programme.desc: Mitchs lifeguard buddys ex-wife dies in Australia so the team joins him on a trip down under.

programme.title: Baywatch Down Under, Part 2
programme.desc: While team Baywatch prepares to compete against the Australian lifeguards.

programme.title: Water Dance
programme.desc: Cody learns a lesson in love when he and Mitch help a violinist escape her dangerous mentor.

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: Alex tries to save a diamond smuggler whose partners want him to "sleep with the fishes."

programme.title: Wave Rage
programme.desc: After Manny suffers a life-altering injury during a rescue, April tries to save him from himself.

programme.title: Galaxy Girls
programme.desc: April and Jessie search for the perfect celebrity host for a seaside beauty contest.

programme.title: Castles in the Sand
programme.desc: Alex searches for the creator of several elaborate sand castles on the beach, but is interrupted.

programme.title: Aloha Baywatch
programme.desc: Mitch puts together an International "Top Gun" style lifeguard school in Hawaii.

programme.title: Mahalo Hawaii
programme.desc: The new Baywatch Hawaii team goes through trials and tribulations learning to work and live together.

programme.title: Weak Link
programme.desc: A dangerous contest puts Dawns future at Baywatch in doubt. Tanner befriends a dying girl.

programme.title: Shark Island
programme.desc: Mitch and Tanner explore Shark Island. Jessie and Kekoa dump JD. Jesse makes a rescue in the nude.

programme.title: Strike Team
programme.desc: Sean leads a daring rescue of 6 kayaking teens stranded off the perilous Na Pali coast.

programme.title: Sunday in Kauai
programme.desc: Jessie and Kekoa battle each other even as they rescue a man stranded behind a waterfall!

programme.title: Risk to Death
programme.desc: Sean threatens to fire Jason. Allie and Dawn have to save a pregnant woman giving birth in the ocean.

programme.title: Father of the Groom
programme.desc: Sean makes a life-or-death decision. Kekoa faces her fear. Mitch objects to Hobie getting married.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Jason, who fears sharks, learns first hand that they are sacred protectors of the Hawaiian Islands.

programme.title: Gold from the Deep
programme.desc: Allie discovers a rare Hawaiian coin that may be part of a priceless sunken treasure.

programme.title: Bent
programme.desc: Allie is terrified she may lose the love of her life when Nick attempts an impossible rescue.

programme.title: Path of Least Resistance
programme.desc: A dark secret from Dawns past could jeopardize her career as a Baywatch Hawaii Lifeguard.

programme.title: Liquid Visions
programme.desc: Dawn experiments with the powers of the mind. Disaster strikes a party boat.

programme.title: Lines in the Sand
programme.desc: When nudists protest, Sean and Jenna must work together to save the day.

programme.title: Thunder Tide
programme.desc: Kekoa, Dawn and Allie assess their femininity. Jason rehearses a love scene with a sexy actress.

programme.title: Breath of Life
programme.desc: Jason is assigned to a Beach where he confronts a terrible incident from his past.

programme.title: Big Island Heat
programme.desc: Sean vows to fight when Jenna tries to take over the team and shut down the training center.

programme.title: The Hero
programme.desc: Sean tells Jenna a secret that could cost his him job. Allie and Jason rescue victims on a lava reef.

programme.title: Maui Exterra
programme.desc: Jessie trains for a triathlon. Jason tracks an underwater spirit that lures people to their deaths.

programme.title: Baywatch Ohana
programme.desc: When Sean risks everything to save Jenna, his darkest secret is revealed.

programme.title: The Last Rescue
programme.desc: Jessies WWII Vet grandfather comes back to Hawaii to end his life. Can Mitch intervene in time?

programme.title: The Killing Machine
programme.desc: A government agent recruits Mitch for a lethal undercover assignment Mitch may not survive.

programme.title: Soul Survivor
programme.desc: Sean clashes with Jenna. A love triangle builds between Zack, Carrie and Jason.

programme.title: Knife in the Heart
programme.desc: Baywatch faces a lawsuit after a rescue. Zack pursues Carrie while shes pursuing Jason.

programme.title: Bad Boyz
programme.desc: Jenna threatens to close Baywatch. Carrie’s fear may end her lifeguard career.

programme.title: Dangerous Games
programme.desc: Leigh goes hang gliding with perilous results. A party gone wrong finds Nani alone in the ocean.

programme.title: Stone Cold
programme.desc: Jason makes a desperate dive to retrieve a donor heart from a plane crash before the patient dies.

programme.title: Broken Promises
programme.desc: To avoid jail, Danny joins Team Baywatch. JD, Zack and Jason get conned by two gorgeous women.

programme.title: Dream Girl
programme.desc: Jenna betrays Sean. Kekoa admits love for JD. Zack encounters a ghostly woman from his dreams.

programme.title: The Cage
programme.desc: A Shark Tour operator endangers swimmers! JD and Kekoa try keeping their relationship a secret.

programme.title: Ben
programme.desc: Seans guilt over after a surfing accident leads to a perilous paddleboard outing.

programme.title: Ties that Bind
programme.desc: Zack and Jason befriend a man and his teenage daughter protecting a dangerous secret.

programme.title: Black Widow
programme.desc: Leigh suspects a tourist of murdering her husband. Jason seduces the tourist with shocking results!

programme.title: Ex-Files
programme.desc: Fake rescue calls put lives in danger. JD wants Kekoa’s father to bless their relationship.

programme.title: The Stalker
programme.desc: Carrie saves a victim who begins stalking her. Leigh must choose between Sean and Sam.

programme.title: Father Faust
programme.desc: Baywatch faces two bizarre lawsuits. A government Investigation puts Sean’s job in jeopardy.

programme.title: Good Man in a Storm
programme.desc: Hurricane Honu hits Hawaii. Baywatch lifeguards battle to save lives, including their own!

programme.title: My Father the Hero
programme.desc: Jenna gets conned. Jason and JD save Dereks life, in more ways than one!

programme.title: Boiling Point
programme.desc: Zack corrupts the headquarters’ computers. Sean worries as a major donor arrives amongst the chaos.

programme.title: The Return of Jessie
programme.desc: JD may be the father of Jessies son. Sean meets a hot woman who might be Pele, the goddess fire.

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: Sean and Leigh are chained in a chamber filling with seawater. Jason and Zack raise money with hula.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: Sean, Jason and Zack compete in a grueling race. Leigh and Jenna pretend to be lesbian lovers.

programme.title: Makapuu Lighthouse
programme.desc: Zack impersonates Sean to thorny results. Jason becomes a fashion model.

programme.title: Rescue Me
programme.desc: When Sam leaves Leigh at the altar, Sean asks her to marry him instead.

programme.title: Panic at Malibu Pier
programme.desc: When the boat capsizes during a fishing trip, Mitch and his friend have to rescue the passengers

programme.title: In Deep
programme.desc: Playing hooky from summer school, Hobie, gets dangerously involved with reckless power skiers.

programme.title: Heat Wave
programme.desc: Steve Humboldt, an old lifeguard buddy of Mitch and Craig, shows up with his son unexpectantly.

programme.title: At the Frontera
programme.desc: When an ATF agent out of Houston is tasked to team up with the Mexico City District Attorney on a human trafficking case, he uncovers family ties with a serpentine real-estate developer. Now he must work with a criminal defense attorney to stop the reign of tyranny.

programme.title: Broken Contract
programme.desc: When Max, a down on his luck strip club owner, has his life and livelihood threatened by local gangsters, he turns to his wife’s connections for help and hires a hitman to solve the problem once and for all.

programme.title: Forsaken Son
programme.desc: Kylie Morgan is a private eye on the hunt for a heartless killer. With nothing but sheer will she soon finds help in a detective, Anthony Woods.

programme.title: Last Shot
programme.desc: A young man is released from prison with a chance to turn his life around. But the streets havent changed since he left.

programme.title: Confused by Love
programme.desc: A non-social author and his socialite wife invites his rich friend and former ex-girlfriend to stay with them for five days in order to save their house from immediate foreclosure.

programme.title: Past Present Future
programme.desc: Rachel and Noah have been best friends since high school. They have also dated on and off over the years. They meet up for the first time after years apart.

programme.title: Treasure Lies
programme.desc: Hardworking teenager Sean feels let down by life, but faces a crisis of character through a series of his own bad decisions.

programme.title: God and Salsa
programme.desc: A grief-stricken therapist determined to help a suicidal teen regains her faith in the process with the help of her Pastor and Salsa instructor.

programme.title: Glass Jaw
programme.desc: Glass Jaw is the redemption story of Travis Austin, a one time champion boxer who goes to prison and loses everything.

programme.title: Fast And Frantic
programme.desc: Lukas, who has always dreamed of running glory, teams up with a group of eccentric biochemists to take on Brakpans quarter mile racing champ.

programme.title: Screened In
programme.desc: Peyton Hawthorne becomes disillusioned when she realizes her phone has taken over her life. She attempts to tackle her addiction but calamity ensues.

programme.title: In His Steps
programme.desc: When a homeless man interrupts the comfortable routine of First Church of Raymond, life will never be the same for the apathetic congregation.

programme.title: Bathing Franky
programme.desc: When an ex-con falls under the spell of a backyard magician, the illusion is shattered.

programme.title: American Sophmore
programme.desc: A group of high school kids enjoy many adventures throughout their formative tenth grade year.

programme.title: The Fat Boy Chronicles
programme.desc: Jimmy always gets teased by the football team for being overweight. As a school assignment he writes about it in his journal, but soon he finds out that he’s not the only kid in school with problems.

programme.title: A Life Lived
programme.desc: The story about the life of a dollar bill, and the many lives it passes along the way.

programme.title: Without Warrant
programme.desc: A young by-the-book detective gets partnered with a seasoned, renegade undercover cop to solve a brutal gangland murder.

programme.title: Damaged Goods
programme.desc: Amandas life might not be ideal--her ex-boyfriend is taking her money, her boss is threatening to fire her, and her landlord wont fix her apartment--but shes absolutely fine.

programme.title: Blur Circle
programme.desc: A feature film about a woman grieving the loss of her son after he disappeared two years ago - until a mysterious man with a camera enters her life.

programme.title: Astronaut: The Last Push
programme.desc: When a tragic accident cuts short the first manned mission to explore life on the moons of Jupiter, Michael Forrest must make the 3 year journey home to Earth in pure solitude.

programme.title: Cream Of The Crop
programme.desc: High-school Ag Science teacher Jodi Stafford meets commercial real-estate marketing specialist Mike Jared during her struggle to save her familys ailing dairy farm.

programme.title: The View From Here
programme.desc: After a bad review of his new restaurant, a Bay Area chef must learn to cope with his struggling relationship and the death of his father.

programme.title: Something Good Coming
programme.desc: After an unforeseen store closure, two grocery store workers from different backgrounds are stuck spending time together over a weekend.

programme.title: You with Me
programme.desc: It tells the story of Kim who lives with her overprotective parents and meets Jayson online. She then ends up moving to Seoul and starts a new life.

programme.title: Sugar!
programme.desc: A housewife of a Republican candidate for U.S. Senate secretly forms an all-women rock band turning her entire world up side down.

programme.title: Not Your Romeo and Juliet
programme.desc: With a popular romance column and a soul-mate, Micki has love all figured out -until a competing, anti-romance column rivals hers.

programme.title: Dog Park
programme.desc: Nick isnt lucky in love - until a trip to the Dog Park with his ex-girlfriends dog changes everything.

programme.title: Who Will Move The Stone
programme.desc: A worldly Detroit lawyer decides to represent a Born Again Christian on trial for the murder of a Catholic Priest.

programme.title: Lucky Louie
programme.desc: A retired cop teams up with four ex-convicts and a behavioral science student to solve a fifty year old bank robbery in this new faith filled family comedy.

programme.title: No Letting Go
programme.desc: What would you do to save your child? A young teenager struggles with a debilitating mental illness as his mom risks everything to save him without losing the rest of her family.

programme.title: The Day You Found Me
programme.desc: The passage of time does not diminish the childhood connection of two friends, a young boy and girl, bound by a promise.

programme.title: The Last Page
programme.desc: After being raised--and abused--in the foster-care system, twin brothers find refuge with a group of misfits who turn out to be a violent band of criminals.

programme.title: Rum Runners
programme.desc: Rum Runners is the epic story of two best friends, Vic Hanson and Don Calyer. They get caught running illegal booze across the Canadian border.

programme.title: Hope
programme.desc: A young man hits rock bottom and has nowhere to turn.

programme.title: July Rising
programme.desc: When sixteen-year old Andy inherits her grandfathers orchard and becomes the ward of her aunt from the city, she must navigate the path to her future from a small town.

programme.title: Maybe Im Fine
programme.desc: A young girl is asked to help get her father to sign divorce papers.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.desc: As we meet the characters, Johnny investigates a case of a little Polish girl snatched on a subway train, Carlos tries to find a 14 year old victim of sexual abuse, Bobby searches for a missing law student, and Connie gets frustrated because she isnt given any cases.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Cabe... What Kind Of Name Is That?
programme.desc: Carlos brings in photos of his newborn son. Bobby searches for the missing son of a Filipino lady, meanwhile a little boy is found who hasnt been reported missing.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 People Dont Talk To Cops, People Lie To Cops
programme.desc: A child is kidnapped from his back yard; an optometrist vanishes on his way home from work; and a young woman doesnt return from the grocery store.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 I Cant Even Imagine
programme.desc: A young woman returning from a European trip does not get off the plane; two teens do not make it home from a party; and a suicide note is found but no body.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Thats My Sister, Pal
programme.desc: Carlos and Connie search for a missing teen who has upset a drug lord.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 The Mans An Emotional Termite
programme.desc: A young womans parents arrive for a visit and find her missing; a young girl is an apparent runaway; and an older mans entire family disappears.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.desc: Missing dental hygienists car is found with Black Magic books and items in the trunk, and her parents cant seem to decide whether or not they want to find her. A wife goes out for groceries and never comes back. Constance gets flowers.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Im Gonna Miss Him Too�
programme.desc: A young boy runs away from home, returning to take his little brother with him, after his potential stepfather steals from their home and blames it on him, and then threatens his life. Connie has to trace the family of an heroic John Doe who saved a little girls life, in order to find out what his medical problems are, and along the way feels some chemistry with the surgeon.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Sometimes You Cant Help Getting Involved�
programme.desc: Connie and Carlos both have to find missing children. Connies case is a 4-year old who disappeared at nursery school, and Carloss is an 8-year old, who is later found badly beaten. When an ex-school friend of Rays, who had been injured in an accident many years ago resulting in him have the mental age of a 6-year old, is accused of the beating, Ray breaks his own number 1 rule and becomes personally involved trying to clear him.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 How Hard Is It Just To Get Off At The Next Exit?
programme.desc: Boy missing for a year has been spotted. An express driver disappears. Johnnys dad, also a cop, gets shot. Robert gets an A on his mid-term.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 If You Could Pick Your Own Parents�
programme.desc: Elderly man missing, wife attempts suicide. Group plans a holiday party for the lieutenant. Jumpers body hasnt been found and no ones reported him missing. Boy reports his mom is missing.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Ive Got A Siren!...
programme.desc: Connie helps a girl who is having a baby and is missing her boyfriend, while Bobby meets an actress who models herself on Lauren Bacall and has driven her husband away with her constant role-playing games.

programme.title: Missing Persons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 My Beautiful Son Is Okay�

programme.title: Missing Persons

programme.sub-title: S01 : E16 Tell Me You Didnt Do It... Ill Go To The Wall For You

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Obscene literature and pictures are spread among youngster at a school in Los Angeles. The supplier of this illegal stuff turns out to be a former film producer from the days of silent movies.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: When two four year old twin girls turn up missing, Sgt. Friday and Officer Smith are called in. The girls are found, but were molested. The officers continue to investigate until they locate the perpetrator.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Sgt. Friday, Smith and newly married Sgt. Austin investigate a string of robberies taking place when people are on vacation. They track some of the property and learn of a moving van that appears at the empty houses.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A holdup man is sticking up bars. After he takes the money he kills many of his victims. Sargeant Friday has few leads other than that the holdup man likes a certain song on the jukebox and likes to drink scotch and water.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A pregnant woman is run down by teens out joyriding leaving Sgt Friday and his fellow officer Smith to track down those responsible. They find that kids are uncooperative, refusing to inform on their friends.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Executive leaves suicide note in his car with pistol, two bullets spent and no trace of the body. Friday and Smith working Homicide, Missing Persons Detail, begin their search for the man.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday, Smith respond to a bank robbery in progress. Car description, partial plate leaves many cars to check.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Sgt Joe Friday and officer Smith struggle to crack a case involving a cat burglar. With all their leads going nowhere and evidence scarce the case seems to be leading to a dead end. Then their luck changes.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A man swindled out of $1,500 life savings from a familiar bunco scam, substitute jewelry for cash, jewelry is imitation.

programme.title: Dragnet

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Joe and Frank investigate a series of burglaries in new housing developments where the suspects signature is the killing of pet birds.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday and Smith attempt to solve a series of car thefts but are getting nowhere until they learn that the car thieves are selling the stolen cars illegally.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday and Smith attempt to stop a robber accused of assaulting and robbing women.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: The detectives take a report of valuables stolen from the home of a somewhat eccentric old lady. They begin to suspect something is amiss when she starts talking about how she gets the "scoop" on crimes by being the first to report them to the local newspaper.

programme.title: Dragnet

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Mysterious Murder at the Farm (Valerie Bary Case)- On Friday, March 26, 2004, in the region of Dijon, Laurent Bary came home from his work to discover the lifeless body of his wife, Valerie, bathing in a pool of blood. According to the investigators initial findings, the 38-year-old nurses aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Bloody Christmas next to the Leman lake (CASE OF RUTH LÉGERET) - On January 4, 2006, Ruth Legeret was found dead in the middle of a pool of blood at her luxurious property in Vevey, Switzerland. Next to her was the lifeless body of her friend, Marina Studer. Who could have killed these two simple and wealthy widows? Clue after clue, the Swiss polices investigation would revolve around an environment of family jealousy and financial greed.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: September 16 2005. The lifeless body of Audrey Jouannet, 24, is found hidden under the bed in her small apartment in Soisy-sur-Seine. It soon becomes apparent that the young woman has been tortured at length before being strangled. But surprisingly, though the highly meticulous murderer has taken care to leave no sign of his passage, the autopsy reveals traces of sperm on the victim. It will take all of the investigators intuition to pierce the mystery of this heinous crime...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Sylvain Dromard finds the body of his wife Laurence lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen. The crime was particularly violent and the theory of a burglary that went wrong is soon excluded. But investigators dont understand who could want the adorable hairdresser of Saint-Martin-dAblois dead. During the investigation, the work of profilers will enable them to draw a very precise portrait of the murderer...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: After an ordinary dinner, Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell suffer severe abdominal pains.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Nelly Cremel, 39, leaves her home to go jogging... never to return. Eight days later, after a vast search campaign, her body is found. Theres no doubt that its murder. The case soon ignites public opinion, even inflaming passions at the highest level of the state. The clues lead investigators on a number of trails, from the shadows of the French secret service to a manhunt for a possible sex maniac, in a case of murder most foul.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Willy Pomonti, a retired architect, is found savagely murdered in his opulent villa in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, near Paris. It soon becomes clear that the man has been tortured prior to death. At several points during this extraordinary enquiry, police will feel theyre holding the culprit... It will take them ten years to finally shed light on this particularly violent crime.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The lifeless body of Christophe Lejard is found by his son just metres from their home. The man was shot in the head as he was getting into his car to go to work. A veritable execution, which at first glance doesnt square with the profile of the quiet family man. Yet behind the appearances, the investigation gradually reveals all the hate and resentment that revolved around the victim.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A man walks into a gendarmerie near Saint-Malo to report that his wife has been missing since the previous day. The couple are going through a divorce, but this mother would never have left her seven children alone! An extensive search is undertaken but the woman cannot be found. What has happened to Adeline Piet? The investigation spans several years and experiences many twists.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The corpse of Priscillia Ciatti, 14, is discovered by the side of a field, a few hundred metres from her family home. The teenager has been stabbed sixty times with a knife and -an extra sordid detail - a devil mask is found next to her body. Was Priscillia the victim of a prowler? A serial killer? A maniac inspired by a horror movie? Investigators soon find that the young girl felt she was being watched, and even threatened...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning, Mathilde Croguennec, 18, attending "Teknival" in Brittany, is found at the foot of a tree with her throat cut. Investigators face the task of finding the killer from among the 43,000 participants of this huge open-air festival of electronic music, where drink and drugs are consumed in abundance. An unusual investigation that leads the police down a number of false avenues.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Arriving at her work, the secretary of a small firm in the suburbs of Geneva finds the body of Jean-Raymond Blatti, the companys new accountant. The man is lying in a pool of blood and, on his belly, the murderer has written "DIRTY RAPIST". Yet Jean-Raymond Blatti was never charged with sexual assault. Over the course of the investigation, this inscription will appear as one of the many mysteries of this case which is particularly rich in twists and turns.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 19th 2004, the naked and tied up body of a woman is recovered in the Ourcq canal in Fresnes-sur-Marne. The victim is impossible to identify.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On April 3th 2003, Chantal Ternik, a 48 year old housewife, is discovered hanged in her house of Sanary-sur-Mer, in Var.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On March 28th 2013, the burnt body of Anne Barbot, 38 years old, is discovered in a forest of Maine-et-Loire.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On May 17th 2005, a body is discovered in a forest of Sucy-en-Brie; Christophe Belle, 40 years old, a renowned pastry cook.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The disturbing missing case in Paris of a four year old.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On October 13th 1996, the body of young Angelique Dumetz, 18 years old, is recovered down a ditch in Oise forest. An important clue is found on the crime scene.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On February 23th 2017, policemen are alerted of the disapearrance of Brigitte Troadec, her husband Pascal, and their children Sebastien and Charlotte.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: T-Rex Timeline
programme.desc: The Tyrannosaurus Rex is known as the king of the dinosaurs, but how did its reign begin? Meet Moros Intrepidus, a 180 lb., deer-sized ancestor to the T-Rex.

programme.title: Raising Dinos From The Dead
programme.desc: Could a 75 million-year-old dinosaur skull that has been sitting in a museum for over 20 years hold the first-ever dinosaur DNA discovered by humans?

programme.title: The Rise and Fall Of T-Rex
programme.desc: T-rex - the "tyrant lizard king" - ruled the earth 65 million years ago. Today, he reigns as the ultimate predator and pop cultural icon.

programme.title: The Permian
programme.desc: Massive geologic changes allowed life to thrive on land and sea, producing saber-toothed carnivores like Gorgonopsid and the terrifying 40-foot shark Helicoprion.

programme.title: The Triassic
programme.desc: After the Permian period, the epic saga of evolution and extinction on Earth produced the worlds first dinosaurs, plesiosaurs and pterosaurs.

programme.title: The Cretaceous
programme.desc: Magnificent and terrifying dinosaurs like Triceratops and Tyrannosaurus ruled the land. But they were all wiped out in an instant by a collision with an asteroid!

programme.title: The Ordovician
programme.desc: For nearly 4 billion years, the continents of Earth were lifeless. But during the Ordovician, there was an explosion of life beneath the sea. Many creatures evolved.

programme.title: The Devonian
programme.desc: Life in the sea rebounded with a vengeance in the Devonian. Dozens of monstrous predators emerged, like the 40-foot long Dunkleosteus.

programme.title: Alien Life
programme.desc: Scientists investigate microbes found in Yellowstone National Parks thermal pools to understand the biology necessary for life at high temperatures.

programme.title: Frozen Archeology
programme.desc: There are places in Greater Yellowstone where the snow never melts, or at least, it never used to. Climate change is causing Yellowstone’s ice patches to recede.

programme.title: The Petrified Forest
programme.desc: Greater Yellowstone sits on top of a volcanic hot spot where devastating geological events unfolded. The result? A bizarre cemetery of fossilized forests.

programme.title: Mammoth Country
programme.desc: The Greater Yellowstone Area was once a rich grazing ground for huge Columbian mammoths. Now it’s a prime hunting ground for paleontologists and archaeologists.

programme.title: The Last Triceratops
programme.desc: Montana’s Hell Creek Formation is home to a trove of late Cretaceous fossils unlike any other in the world, revealing the last days of the great dinosaurs.

programme.title: Past and Future Yellowstone
programme.desc: Craters of the Moon National Monument is desolate – but 2,200 years ago, it was the site of today’s Yellowstone Hotspot, known for violent eruptions and huge craters.

programme.title: Worlds Best Dinosaur Fossil
programme.desc: An extraordinary new discovery of a dinosaur fossil so pristine and complete, that it shows off the texture, patterns, and color of a prehistoric giant. Discover this brand new species that roamed during the late Jurassic and Cretaceous periods.

programme.title: Recovering From Extinction
programme.desc: How long does it take for life to rebound after a major mass extinction? Scientists in Svalbard dig through fossil clues for surprising revelations about our Earths history.

programme.title: T-Rex Timeline
programme.desc: The Tyrannosaurus Rex is known as the king of the dinosaurs, but how did its reign begin? Meet Moros Intrepidus, a 180 lb., deer-sized ancestor to the T-Rex.

programme.desc: Could a 75 million-year-old dinosaur skull that has been sitting in a museum for over 20 years hold the first-ever dinosaur DNA discovered by humans?

programme.title: The Rise and Fall Of T-Rex

programme.title: The Triassic
programme.desc: After the Permian period, the epic saga of evolution and extinction on Earth produced the worlds first dinosaurs, plesiosaurs and pterosaurs.

programme.title: The Cretaceous
programme.desc: Magnificent and terrifying dinosaurs like Triceratops and Tyrannosaurus ruled the land. But they were all wiped out in an instant by a collision with an asteroid!

programme.title: Blood Pattern Analysis
programme.desc: Can investigators decipher what happened at a crime scene based on the size and shape of bloodstains left behind? What can fluid dynamics tell us about the technique?

programme.title: Bite Mark Analysis
programme.desc: Bitemark Analysis appeared to fit neatly in the respected field of forensic dentistry until two researchers performed a bitemark study on cadavers.

programme.title: Firearm Examination
programme.desc: Firearms Analysis is one of the most relied upon forensic science methods in the US, but its foundational validity and reliability are now facing serious questions.

programme.title: Shaken Baby Syndrome
programme.desc: Shaken Baby Syndrome is a household name, but shockingly it may not be a valid diagnosis at all. New biomechanical research has changed the conversation.

programme.title: Footwear Analysis
programme.desc: Shoe prints seem like the most classic, helpful piece of evidence at a crime scene. But how does the science behind this comparison technique hold up?

programme.title: Arson Investigation
programme.desc: In just one generation Arson investigation changed from myth-based to a science-based discipline. What is the future for those still wrongly behind bars?

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: This film follows the race to generate vast power from thin air - the wind. One of the worlds biggest windfarms is being built off the English coast.

programme.title: Aviation
programme.desc: The way we fly is about to change, driven by a new breed of aviators not afraid to think differently. Could the days of the jet age be numbered?

programme.title: Fusion
programme.desc: It is the greatest technological challenge ever undertaken by humankind. The quest to produce the ultimate energy solution‚ Fusion.

programme.title: Tidal
programme.desc: The power of the oceans tides is the last great untapped energy source on Earth. Teams of engineers race to perfect the technology to harness the vast flows of water.

programme.title: Maritime
programme.desc: Shipping companies and engineers are creating new machines to make their industry greener using a resource that has moved man across oceans for thousands of years...Wind.

programme.desc: The sun is the biggest source of energy in the solar system. Innovators are searching for new ways to capture more of the suns power.

programme.title: The Dogs of Hurricane Dorian
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug Thron takes his infrared drone from the hurricane-devastated Bahamas to the wildfire scorched hills of California, locating and rescuing dogs, horses, and more.

programme.title: Lost Dogs of Louisiana
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In the wake of Hurricane Laura, Doug heads to Louisiana to help a local firefighter find his lost dog and begin rescue operations in the hard-hit city of Lake Charles.

programme.title: 13 Days After Hurricane Laura
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: With the help of expert animal rescuer, Aja Estro, Doug continues his tireless search and rescue missions across the town of Lake Charles following Hurricane Laura.

programme.title: Oregon Fire Cats
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug ventures into the charred neighborhoods of Talent, OR with an old friend, Shannon Jay, to save any of the unlucky felines left behind in the wildfire evacuations.

programme.title: Puerto Rico Rescue Pups
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug is called to Puerto Rico to help old friend and rescue partner, Aja Estro, with the massive stray dog population and hoarding cases across the island.

programme.title: Chasing Ghost
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug checks in on some of the dogs he’s rescued before turning his attention to the high desert outside LA and a boxer who’s spent 15 months fending for itself.

programme.title: Island Dogs
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In our season opener, Doug takes his drone to the Dominican Republic to rescue puppies that have been abandoned in the municipal town dump.

programme.title: Urban Hyenas
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug travels to Malawi, in Central Africa, to work with hyena researchers who are eager to employ his drone. What the infrared camera shows them will surprise them all.

programme.title: Bats of Malawi
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug visits Malawi, in Central Africa, to experiment in ways his drone can assist wildlife conservation research… pioneering work that can revolutionize field science.

programme.title: Dixie Fire Foxes
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: After the Dixie Fire devastates the CA town of Greenville, Doug heads in with his old friend Shannon to rescue the lost cats and wild animals that have been left behind.

programme.title: Tornado Town
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In the season finale, Doug takes his drone to the tornado-ravaged towns of Kentucky to rescue the slew of cats and dogs that have been lost in the brutal December storm.

programme.title: Asteroid Belt Discovery
programme.desc: New evidence from NASAs Dawn mission to Ceres, a dwarf planet the size of Texas.

programme.title: Space Junk Dangers
programme.desc: A ballistic missile test by India recently shot down one of its own communications satellites.

programme.title: Mars InSight: Seven Minutes to Touchdown
programme.desc: The fate of the Mars InSight lander will all come down to a fiery seven-minute freefall into the Red Planet. Will it survive?

programme.title: Exoplanets
programme.desc: NASA may have just gotten one step closer to answering the question: are we alone? The Spitzer Telescope has made a groundbreaking discovery of exoplanets.

programme.title: Cassini: The Grand Finale
programme.desc: Twenty years after its launch, we bid farewell to the Cassini spacecraft as it plunges into Saturn’s atmosphere in a planned death spiral.

programme.title: Asteroids, Comets, and Meteors
programme.desc: How do these objects differ from one another, if at all? Nick Moskovitz, an astronomer at the Lowell Observatory, compares these two space solar system bodies.

programme.title: New Horizons: The Kuiper Belt Target
programme.desc: The New Horizons spacecraft revolutionized our understanding of the solar system as it rocketed past Pluto. Now, the craft approaches its next target…Ultima Thule.

programme.title: Direct From An Asteroid
programme.desc: The Hayabusa2 spacecraft has just completed one of the most intricate procedures in space exploration.

programme.title: The First Picture of a Black Hole
programme.desc: For the first time, scientists have captured a photograph of a black hole.

programme.title: Touching the Sun
programme.desc: NASAs Parker Probe Plus is on a mission to learn more about the Sun -- flying through dangerous radiation to become the closest spaceship to orbit our Sun.

programme.title: Private Moonshot
programme.desc: A non-profit organization established in 2011 is aiming to land the first Israeli spacecraft on the Moon. This is the story of their attempt and the excitement of being the first private company to have a spacecraft launched with the intention of going to and landing on the moon.

programme.title: Modern Day Killer Asteroid
programme.desc: 66 million years ago, an asteroid slammed into Mexico’s Yucatán Peninsula, causing a dinosaur mass extinction. Whats in store for humanity if it happens again?

programme.title: Hayabusa2: Asteroid Explosion
programme.desc: Hayabusa2 just became the first spacecraft to take subsurface samples of an asteroid. How did they do it?

programme.title: Saturn: The Moon King
programme.desc: The latest developments in space technology continue to reveal the wonders of our solar system. With new moons recently spotted orbiting Saturn, the gas giant has taken the lead in our cosmic neighborhoods moon count.

programme.title: Artemis: First Launch
programme.desc: This is an inside look at NASAs groundbreaking Artemis Program, the spacecraft, and the people who will bring humanity one step closer to the moon, Mars, and beyond.

programme.title: First Images: The James Webb Telescope
programme.desc: The dawn of a new era in astronomy has begun as the world gets its first look at the full capabilities of NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope.

programme.title: Mars: The Journey
programme.desc: The faint red glow of Mars has intrigued those watching it from Earth for centuries. Now space exploration has begun to lift the veil on "The Red Planet".

programme.title: Asteroid Belt Discovery
programme.desc: New evidence from NASAs Dawn mission to Ceres, a dwarf planet the size of Texas.

programme.title: Space Junk Dangers
programme.desc: A ballistic missile test by India recently shot down one of its own communications satellites.

programme.title: Mars InSight: Seven Minutes to Touchdown
programme.desc: The fate of the Mars InSight lander will all come down to a fiery seven-minute freefall into the Red Planet. Will it survive?

programme.title: Exoplanets
programme.desc: NASA may have just gotten one step closer to answering the question: are we alone? The Spitzer Telescope has made a groundbreaking discovery of exoplanets.

programme.title: Cassini: The Grand Finale
programme.desc: Twenty years after its launch, we bid farewell to the Cassini spacecraft as it plunges into Saturn’s atmosphere in a planned death spiral.

programme.title: Asteroids, Comets, and Meteors
programme.desc: How do these objects differ from one another, if at all? Nick Moskovitz, an astronomer at the Lowell Observatory, compares these two space solar system bodies.

programme.title: New Horizons: The Kuiper Belt Target
programme.desc: The New Horizons spacecraft revolutionized our understanding of the solar system as it rocketed past Pluto. Now, the craft approaches its next target…Ultima Thule.

programme.title: Direct From An Asteroid
programme.desc: The Hayabusa2 spacecraft has just completed one of the most intricate procedures in space exploration.

programme.title: The First Picture of a Black Hole
programme.desc: For the first time, scientists have captured a photograph of a black hole.

programme.title: Touching the Sun
programme.desc: NASAs Parker Probe Plus is on a mission to learn more about the Sun -- flying through dangerous radiation to become the closest spaceship to orbit our Sun.

programme.title: Private Moonshot
programme.desc: A non-profit organization established in 2011 is aiming to land the first Israeli spacecraft on the Moon. This is the story of their attempt and the excitement of being the first private company to have a spacecraft launched with the intention of going to and landing on the moon.

programme.title: Modern Day Killer Asteroid
programme.desc: 66 million years ago, an asteroid slammed into Mexico’s Yucatán Peninsula, causing a dinosaur mass extinction. Whats in store for humanity if it happens again?

programme.title: Hayabusa2: Asteroid Explosion
programme.desc: Hayabusa2 just became the first spacecraft to take subsurface samples of an asteroid. How did they do it?
